textfields.tf: The electronic control provides faster and more exact raising and lowering.
Only using an electronic air suspension system it´s possible to adjust the load platform to the ramp height.
ECAS reduces the air consumption when driving.
ECAS provides the additional functions of self-monitoring and diagnosis.
Only using an electronic air suspension system it´s possible to retain the driving level and thus the spring travel.
Mark all correct statements regarding the advantages of the electronic air suspension system ECAS compared to conventional air suspension systems.
That´s true. The control unit is able to achieve a desired height faster and more exact as it is possible via manual control.
That´s wrong. Even using a conventional air suspension system the platform can be adjusted to the ramp height. However, it´s not performed automatically.
That´s true. ECAS consumes less air, because the control unit recognizes whether the vehicle is in motion, and the driving level is readjusted no more than necessary.
That´s right. During operation the control unit is able to detect error conditions, to react immediately and to store them internally for subsequent diagnosis.
This statement is not correct, because also a conventional air suspension system is able to perform this. However, not so exact as ECAS can.
That´s true. ECAS reacts at the push on a button. For instance a specific height stored in the control unit is automatically addressed, without annoying manual readjustment.
That´s right, you marked all appropriate statements.
